page.title: 12Brief Historical Outline.
page.content: There have been settlements in the area since before history was written. Excavations at Hadleigh, south of the Church found evidence of human habitation during the Iron Age. The name Hadleigh is of Saxon derivation meaning:"the clearing near the heath". Today much of the original woodland and farmland has given way to housing and the areas are known as{Hadleigh, {Leigh-on-Sea}or{Eastwood.}Only street and pub. names remind us of historicl associations: Daws Heath named after Philip Dawe or "The Waggon and Horses" or Softwater Lane. The area names may be dropped as people become accustomed to using the{post-codes}devised by the Post Office to simplify the sorting of mail.e.g.Hadleigh Jun.Sch.is{SS7 2DQ.} The A13 follows the routes that have been tramped since early times.Today it is a very busy road.
